actor_awards.notes: She is one of the few actresses to have two Stars on the Hollywood Walk of Fame (one for Motion Pictures, one for Television). Best known for her iconic television mother roles in 'Lassie' and 'Lost in Space'. Won a Tony Award for Outstanding Performance by a Newcomer for 'For Love or Money' (1948).

filmography.title: A Christmas Carol
filmography.role_description: The daughter of Bob Cratchit in this classic MGM adaptation of the Dickens tale. Her film debut.
filmography.plot: An elderly miser learns the error of his ways on Christmas Eve after being visited by three spirits.

filmography.title: Sergeant York
filmography.role_description: The younger sister of the title character, played by Gary Cooper.
filmography.plot: A hillbilly sharpshooter gets drafted in WWI and becomes one of the most decorated soldiers in American history.

filmography.title: Meet Me in St. Louis
filmography.role_description: A sophisticated young woman from New York who becomes a romantic rival, then friend, to the Smith sisters.
filmography.plot: In the year leading up to the 1904 St. Louis World's Fair, the four Smith daughters learn lessons of life and love.

filmography.title: She-Wolf of London
filmography.role_description: A young heiress who fears she is under a family curse that turns her into a werewolf.
filmography.plot: A young woman is convinced that she is the culprit behind a series of grisly murders in a London park.

filmography.title: Son of Lassie
filmography.role_description: The granddaughter of the Duke of Rudling who helps raise the collie Laddie.
filmography.plot: Lassie's son Laddie, considered a failure as a war dog, stows away on a bomber and parachutes into Nazi-occupied Norway.

filmography.title: T-Men
filmography.role_description: The wife of a counterfeiter who gets caught in the crossfire of a federal investigation.
filmography.plot: Two Treasury agents go undercover to infiltrate a counterfeiting ring.

filmography.title: Lost in Space
filmography.role_description: The biochemist matriarch of the Robinson family, providing stability and intelligence during their space adventures. (TV Series)
filmography.plot: A space family, their pilot, and a stowaway villain are thrown off course and must survive in deep space.
filmography.awards: Primetime Emmy: Nomination – Outstanding Special Visual Effects

filmography.title: Lassie
filmography.role_description: The adoptive mother of Timmy who cares for the famous collie on the farm. (TV Series)
filmography.plot: The ongoing adventures of the Martin family and their beloved collie, Lassie.
filmography.awards: Primetime Emmy: Nomination – Best Actress in a Leading Role (Continuing Character) in a Dramatic Series

filmography.title: Time Limit
filmography.role_description: The wife of a Major accused of collaborating with the enemy during the Korean War.
filmography.plot: An investigator tries to uncover why a highly decorated officer collaborated with the enemy in a Korean POW camp.
filmography.awards: National Board of Review: Top Ten Films

filmography.title: Adam Had Four Sons
filmography.role_description: One of the love interests in this family drama starring Ingrid Bergman.
filmography.plot: A governess cares for a widower's four sons and secretly loves him, but trouble arrives when one son brings home a scheming wife.

filmography.title: Bury Me Dead
filmography.role_description: A wealthy woman believed to be dead who returns to attend her own funeral and find her attempted killer.
filmography.plot: A woman thought to have died in a fire returns home to discover who really died and who wanted her dead.

filmography.title: All This, and Heaven Too
filmography.role_description: One of the children in the household where the new governess is employed.
filmography.plot: A French governess in 1840s Paris is accused of having an affair with her employer, leading to a scandal and murder.

filmography.title: The White Cliffs of Dover
filmography.role_description: A young woman in England during the turbulent years of both World Wars.
filmography.plot: An American woman travels to England in 1914, meets a baronet, loses him in WWI, and raises her son to fight in WWII.

filmography.title: It's a Joke, Son!
filmography.role_description: The daughter of Senator Claghorn in this comedy based on the popular radio character.
filmography.plot: A blustery Southern senator faces a re-election challenge from his own wife.

filmography.title: Keep Your Powder Dry
filmography.role_description: A WAC recruit in this wartime drama about women in the military.
filmography.plot: Three women from very different backgrounds join the Women's Army Corps during World War II.

filmography.title: Easy to Wed
filmography.role_description: A society girl involved in a libel suit scheme in this remake of 'Libeled Lady'.
filmography.plot: A newspaper hires a gigolo to compromise a woman who is suing them for libel.

filmography.title: Miss Annie Rooney
filmography.role_description: A wealthy snob who looks down on the titular character played by Shirley Temple.
filmography.plot: The daughter of a poor man falls in love with a rich boy, but his family disapproves.

filmography.title: Troll
filmography.role_description: A mysterious witch who lives in an apartment building invaded by trolls and helps the protagonist fight them.
filmography.plot: A wicked troll king in search of a mystical ring that will return him to his human form invades a San Francisco apartment complex.

filmography.title: Lost in Space
filmography.role_description: A cameo role as Will Robinson's school principal in the film adaptation of her famous series.
filmography.plot: The Robinson family was going into space to fight for a chance for humanity. Now they are fighting to live long enough to find a way home.

filmography.title: Petticoat Junction
filmography.role_description: The lady doctor who takes up residence at the Shady Rest Hotel. (TV Series)
filmography.plot: The adventures of the staff and neighbors of the Shady Rest Hotel.

filmography.title: Strange Invaders
filmography.role_description: A woman institutionalized for claiming aliens took her daughter.
filmography.plot: A professor searches for his ex-wife and daughter in a town that was taken over by aliens in the 1950s.

filmography.title: The Big Picture
filmography.role_description: A supporting role in Christopher Guest's satire of the film industry.
filmography.plot: A fresh film school grad gets a deal to direct a movie, but he watches as his vision is slowly compromised by the studio.

filmography.title: Butterfly
filmography.role_description: A supporting role in this controversial drama starring Pia Zadora.
filmography.plot: A man is accused of improper relations with his daughter in a Nevada mining town.
filmography.awards: Golden Raspberry Award: Nomination – Worst Supporting Actress

filmography.title: Rented Lips
filmography.role_description: The mother of Martin Mull's character in this satire on filmmaking.
filmography.plot: A documentary filmmaker is forced to direct a porn film to get his own project made.

filmography.title: Wesley
filmography.role_description: The mother of John and Charles Wesley, the founders of Methodism.
filmography.plot: A biographical film about John Wesley, the founder of the Methodist movement.
